newsitem.title: DUBAI: Fujairah bunker market lags rallying crude.
newsitem.headline: Fujairah bunker market lags rallying crude.

text.p: The Fujairah bunker market in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) hugged five year highs on Wednesday but remained one of the most competitive price centres for ship bunkering fuel, Gulf bunker traders said.

Fujairah 380-cst bunker fuel was assessed at $116-118 a tonne by local traders, compared to prices of around $130 in northwest Europe and nearly $150 in New York harbour which have been fanned higher by rallying world crude prices.
"It's lagging the rise in crude because there is plenty available in Singapore and Fujairah," a Gulf trader said.
Singapore 380-cst was quoted at $123-124 on Thursday.
Traders in the Fujairah market said that trade was thin amid good supplies but that prices had scope to improve to slowly catch up with other regional markets.
Saudi Aramco is expected to announce its new bunker prices for the week beginning October 17 later on Wednesday.
